- LHP MacKenzie Gore
- OF Robert Hassell III
- SS C.J. Abrams
- OF James Wood
- RHP Jarlin Susana
- one more major league player

That's the only holdup right now to the agreed-upon deal.

@wastro @AndreaMarie13 PHEW. Okay, I think I've maybe, uhm, gotten ahead of myself & sent... uh, maybe a few months worth of recommendations, but I'm probably still forgetting some great books! I didn't even look at my actual bookshelf üòÖ Enjoy all the reading!! ü§ó
@wastro @AndreaMarie13 Waiting for Tom Hanks and Not Like the Movies by Kerry Winfrey are fun rom-coms! I think they lean more rom-com, rather than spicy, but I can't fully remember üòÖ

@wastro @AndreaMarie13 The League of Extraordinary Women is a great series of British Suffragetes who find love while still sticking to their values in a time when marrying a man meant basically becoming his property. (Idk if you do audio books, but the male protagonist in the 3rd is Scottish üëÄ)

@wastro @AndreaMarie13 Well Met, Well Played, & Well Matched by Jen DeLuca are 3 great rom-coms set in a town that holds an annual Renaissance faire!! You didn't mention Historical Romances, but I really liked most of Julia Quinn's books (The Bridgerton series & beyond!)

@wastro @AndreaMarie13 (Yes, I am scrolling through my Libby from the last 3 years, lol). Beach Read is great! One to Watch is less spicy, but about a plus-size lead cast in a Bachelorette-like dating show. Weather Girl was a great "let's get our bosses back together, whoops we fell in love!" story!

@wastro @AndreaMarie13 Christina Lauren is a writing duo that is usually an automatic yes for me--The Unhoneymooners is a great first book to try! So is Josh & Hazel's Guide to Not Dating. The Flatshare by Beth O'Leary is a great Rom-com with an interesting set-up.

@wastro @AndreaMarie13 The Brown sisters trilogy by Talia Herbert is good too--interesting characters & very diverse! Also, they're British which is fun! üòÖ Omg! THE BROMANCE BOOK CLUB! Yes, it's exactly what it says. It's a series. Men learning to talk about their feelings & accept love. I love them.

@wastro @AndreaMarie13 For other spicy fiction, I love Jasmine Gilroy (most of her books since The Wedding Date have side characters that then become leads which I'm a BIG fan of, as it answers the question I always have of "what happened to her best friend!?"). Also, diverse characters!! üòç

@AndreaMarie13 Don't know if you're still looking for some recommendations, but I think @tahneeah has more than a few! She's been ripping through a spicy fantasy series lately that sounds like what you're looking for!
